items.title: GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
items.content: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.
key_points: GPT-5.2 proposed a new formula for a gluon amplitude.
Formula was formally proved and verified.
Collaboration between OpenAI and academic researchers.

items.title: Fine-tuning open LLM judges to outperform GPT-5.2
items.content: Fine-tuned open-source LLM judges can outperform GPT-5.2 at evaluating model outputs. Using Direct Preference Optimization on just 5,400 preference pairs, we trained GPT-OSS 120B to beat GPT-5.2 on human preference alignmentâ€”at 15x lower cost and 14x faster inference speeds.

items.title: Together Evaluations now supports comparing top commercial APIs vs. open source models
items.content: Together Evaluations now supports OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google models for cross-provider benchmarking. Compare open-source, fine-tuned, and proprietary models side-by-side to make data-driven decisions on quality, cost, and performanceâ€”all in one platform.

items.title: OpenClaw
items.content: OpenClaw is a personal AI assistant that connects your messaging apps to local AI coding agents, all running on your own device.
key_points: OpenClaw is a personal AI assistant.
It connects messaging apps to local AI coding agents.
It runs entirely on the user's device.

items.title: Introducing GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark
items.content: Introducing GPT-5.3-Codex-Sparkâ€”our first real-time coding model. 15x faster generation, 128k context, now in research preview for ChatGPT Pro users.

items.title: New in Agent Builder: all new agent chat, file uploads + tool registry
items.content:
Today, we're expanding what you can do with LangSmith Agent Builder. It’s an big update built around a simple idea: working with an agent should feel like working with a teammate.

We rebuilt Agent Builder around this idea. There is now an always available agent (”

items.title: ollama launch
items.content: ollama launch is a new command which sets up and runs coding tools like Claude Code, OpenCode, and Codex with local or cloud models. No environment variables or config files needed.
key_points: ollama launch is a new command for setting up coding tools.
It supports Claude Code, OpenCode, and Codex.
It works with both local and cloud models.
It eliminates the need for environment variables or config files.

items.title: Improving Deep Agents with harness engineering
items.content:
TLDR: Our coding agent went from Top 30 to Top 5 on Terminal Bench 2.0. We only changed the harness. Here’s our approach to harness engineering (teaser: self-verification & tracing help a lot).

The Goal of Harness Engineering
